body: @like8 Great question and something all of us think about. However much as a I am long I am not optimistic. Any take out would be highly dilutive to the acquirer’s stock and realistically $AAPL is the only one with sufficient cash. Apple tends not to do large acquisitions and I’m not sure they’re really looking to move the needle on becoming a major broadcaster or content provider. They tend to “home-grow” things like AppleTV+, credit cards, music, etc. $AMZN has deep pockets but they just closed on MGM so there could be ant-trust concerns. Don’t get me wrong, I’d love this to happen. Just can’t reconcile who would  come up with $50 billion to do it.
$AAPL I’m thinking around $174 then a turn down

links.title: Good News for Apple: Mac Sales Surge as Global PC Market Shrinks
links.description: First quarter PC sales shrunk globally after a two-year pandemic surge, but Apple () bucked the trend with growth. Apple's long-term plan to shift Macs and MacBooks to its own processors is paying off. This is another sign that investors should consider buying AAPL stock while it is still off its 2022 high.

message.body: $AABB so here's the unofficial news. AABB just dropped a merchant payment solution through its cryptocurrency payment gateway named "PayAABB." What does PayAABB offer prospective merchants? A contemporary, convenient, flexible, secure, confidential, and instantaneous method of receiving payments for their goods and services, AND access to a 24/7/365 cryptocurrency exchange that allows for the conversion of their crypto-payment to a number of other cryptocurrencies and/or stablecoins. AABB Ecosystem on full display folks!
